title: Grouping Terms
text: Express the equation in standard form by first grouping the terms with the same variable so you get $$9x^2-18x-16y^2+32y=151$$
speech: Express the equation in standard form by first grouping the terms with the same variable so you get  9 x squared, minus 18 x minus 16 y squared, plus 32 y is equal to 151
pacedSpeech: Express the equation in standard form by first grouping the terms with the same variable so you get   9 x squared, minus 18 x minus 16 y squared, plus 32 y is equal to 151

title: Factoring Out Coefficient
text: Factor the leading coefficient of each expression so you get $$9\left(x^2-2x\right)-\operatorname{16}\left(y^2-2y\right)=151$$
speech: Factor the leading coefficient of each expression so you get  9 times, parentheses, x squared minus 2 x  minus 16 of, parentheses, y squared minus 2 y  is equal to 151
pacedSpeech: Factor the leading coefficient of each expression so you get   9 times, , x squared minus 2 x  minus 16 of, , y squared minus 2 y  is equal to 151

title: Complete the Square
text: Complete the square twice and make sure to balance the equation by adding same constants on each side so you'll have $$9\left(x^2-2x+1\right)-\operatorname{16}\left(y^2-2y+1\right)=151+9-16$$
speech: Complete the square twice and make sure to balance the equation by adding same constants on each side so you'll have  9 times parentheses, x squared minus 2 x plus 1  minus 16 of parentheses, y squared minus 2 y plus 1  is equal to, 151 plus 9 minus 16
pacedSpeech: Complete the square twice and make sure to balance the equation by adding same constants on each side so you'll have   9 times , x squared minus 2 x plus 1  minus 16 of , y squared minus 2 y plus 1  is equal to, 151 plus 9 minus 16

title: Rewrite and Divide
text: Rewrite as perfect squares and divide both sides by constants so that it's in standard form $$\frac{{\left(x-1\right)}^2}{4^2}-\frac{{\left(y-1\right)}^2}{3^2}=1$$
speech: Rewrite as perfect squares and divide both sides by constants so that it's in standard form  fraction, parentheses x minus 1,  squared, over, 4 squared,  minus fraction, parentheses y minus 1,  squared, over, 3 squared,  is equal to 1
